author: gcolvin
content:
I have no desire to spend my time restoring a pre-Berlin draft.  The changes to the present draft are all in answer to criticisms of the Berlin proposal.  (Not static and not offering enough safety, which I've fixed.  Mistaken claims about performance, which I've corrected.)  And a lot of the text remains the same.  So I see it as ongoing work on the same ideas, and suspect withdrawing it in favor of a new number now would only cause confusion.  But I see your point.

My inclination is to wait and see what comes of our discussions.  I can see pulling portions of EIP-2315 and EIP-3779 together, or splitting them apart.  @Arachnid's EIP-3336 andEIP- 3337 are out there, you have ideas about mapping procedures to EOF code sections, and so on.  So zero or more new EIPs might be the result, and the old ones withdrawn anyway.

author: alita85
content: heads up that the bot is mass merging stagnant PRs right now (they were open for more than 2 weeks)

author: alita85
content: it's kind of crazy, but keep in mind that this is growing pain

author: alita85
content: okay, so I have fixed up several bugs + cleaned up the branches. The reason for the spam was because I was developing the main ethereum/EIPs repo. I shouldn't have done this. I will be using a private fork moving forward. Thank you all for your patience.

author: sky.cactus
content: <@104006934562107392> Are we all done with the bot spam, or should we expect more?

author: sky.cactus
content: Once everything is settled, it would be nice to get a retrospective on what exactly happened and why we ended up opening => closing => opening => closing => opening PRs.

author: alita85
content:
It's all done now. Yeah for sure.

Root Cause:
I was using the bot's key on my local machine. I did that because it's easier to develop on production. Also, it was a habit for me because I had done it previously a few times without issue. This time was different because I made a lot of changes, and so the bot wasn't working correctly for a while. 

I think it also stems from me thinking opening / closing is not a big deal. But I can understand why this would be annoying.

Action items:
- develop on a private fork
